text: The code to install R is what it is, so there should be no problem using that (and indeed is used elsewhere, e.g. <https://docs.rstudio.com/resources/install-r/>). So I think we should be okay to describe this in our own words and refer to the manual if there are specific parts we wish to highlight - in the same way as you would reference a paper to make a point. If there is a lot of content that you want to reuse, we may have to replace the CC-BY license with a permission notice as described - although I agree it is similar in spirit to CC BY SA, the CC BY SA would require sharing that license and not the permission notice above. Alternatively we'd need to ask R core if we can use a CC BY SA license instead, but that might need agreement of all R Core, so could delay things quite a bit.
